features: 【Wide Compatibility:】The laptop stand for desk is compatible with all laptops from 10" up to 15.6", such as Mac MacBook Pro 16 14 inch 2021 Air 12 13, Great Christmas Gifts Thanksgiving Present.

【Ergonomic Design】You can adjust the laptop stand height and angle to a perfect eye level which helps to reduce shoulder and neck pain. Which ensures you are in a comfortable position no matter sitting down or standing up.
【Foldable & Portable】Laptop stand for desk can be fully Foldable, it is easy to use, and carry. Suitable for working at home, office, and outdoors, makes typing easier.

【Stable & Durable】laptop riser comes with a larger base greatly improves the stability of the notebook stand, thus giving the stand a more stable performance, Anti-skid silicone can protect your laptop from sliding.
【Heat Dissipation】The computer stand for the laptop offers better ventilation and more airflow to cool your laptop and prevent it from overheating.

What is the material of this laptop stand? Differing from traditional aluminum alloy materials, the innovative use of a combination of aluminum alloy and plastic panels has enabled us to simultaneously ensure product stability while reducing its weight. What are the product's external dimensions, maximum weight capacity, and maximum height? The panel dimensions are 10.6 by 8.46 inches, with an adjustable height range of 1.4 to 7.5 inches, suitable for laptops with a maximum size of 16 inches. What is the maximum adjustable angle for this laptop stand? This laptop riser features dual-axis dual-layer adjustability, offering a range from 0 to 180 degrees, designed ergonomically to promote proper posture and alleviate discomfort in the shoulders and back.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2021
reviews.reviewText: This laptop stand is light, sturdy, compact, but not to the point where you have to use a lot of muscle to maneuver it into position. Once it’s set, it will stay there - no worries about it slowly sinking, or needing to reset it either. I had another laptop stand, but it was huge and very cumbersome. This can be set up on a table without much room, and adjusted to your needs in less than a minute. I’m sure you won’t be disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Urmust Laptop Stand
reviews.reviewText: The stand did everything it advertised. It does a great job of securely supporting my new MacBook Air M1, and holds it at the right height to minimize neck strain. I use a separate blue tooth keyboard, since the laptop keyboard is elevated such that using the keyboard is not really practical, but that’s OK with me. You could type on the laptop keyboard when in the stand, but that causes a bit of wobble, but its nothing that affect the security of your laptop when supported by the Urmust stand. Overall, I am extremely satisfied with the product and would recommend it highly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for a 13inch, a bit shaky for a 15.6
reviews.reviewText: I have a 15.6inch gaming laptop and a 13inch Macbook Air.The mac was more of the reason I got this stand because with the smaller screen size, I had more trouble with having to bend down to look at the monitor. Putting it on this stand, the screen is at a much more comfortable height. It feels stable, and not at all like it's going to fall over.The gaming laptop is a whole different beast. I'm impressed with the sturdyness of the stand, because the laptop is over 8lbs, which is just under the 10lbs limit the seller mentioned. It doesn't feel like it's going to collapse under the weight of my laptop. But compared to the size of the stand, the laptop is much larger, and it feels like my laptop could easily tip over if I accidentally touch one of the corners or tilt the screen back too much.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great stand but laptop with buttons located on top of display panel be aware
reviews.reviewText: The stand works as expected. Don't expect to do constant work (like typing) when the laptop is on the stand. If you do use it to type while laptop is on the stand, you'll be constantly holding your entire arms up.My wife mainly uses the stand for video calls where the laptop camera needs to be high.One thing to note. She has a surface book 2 (13 inch). When the laptop cover is closed, the volume button on the top of the display screen would hit the metal catching edge on the bottom stand. The metal catching edge on the bottom stand is there to catch and prevent the laptop from sliding off the stand. The volume control would make contact with the metal edge and cause the volume control to stick (if leaved closed long enough). When you turn on the laptop, Windows will constantly flash the volume control ON\OFF (volume up\down) because it thinks you're pressing/depressing the volume button. You'll need to slide the surface laptop to the left to prevent this issue.Other than this, the stand works great. Wife likes it and gets the job done for her.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2021
reviews.reviewText: It shakes bad when typing and on a zoom.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Affordable, sturdy, serves its purpose well
reviews.reviewText: It’s pretty sturdy. My laptop is fairly lightweight and not too big. I feel like I wouldn’t be able to have the stand up as high as I do if it was bigger or heavier. It’s perfect though and a real life saver for my neck and eyes!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Our daughter works from home two days a week for an investment bank. In her room she has two large PC monitors and needs a laptop stand for her laptop to be sited next to, and at the same level as, the PC monitors. This fits the bill perfectly for that. It is strong, robust, easy to adjust and looks fantastic. All at a very good price too.
have had the product for over a year and still works well. helps keep my wrists at a better angle and supports them. would 10/10 reckoned for anyone who uses a computer regularly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It's ironic isn't it? We all move onto laptops because of their convenience, but then we realise that laptops are not good for posture and we get aching necks and shoulders. So, it's a good thing that stands like these exist so you can use your laptop as a monitor, and add a separate keyboard and mouse, to turn it back into the desktop you used to have with a screen at a good height.This is a really solid auminium stand, which holds my laptop well. The box spanner supplied ensures that it's easy to adjust, and easy to tighten so it stays put. It's not ideal for a the largest recommended size 15.6in laptop if you don't have a spare keyboard handy, as you'll 'feel' the overhang when typing. The silicone pads do help hold it in place though, I had no worries about my laptop falling off the stand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 14, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I wasn't expecting much from this and purchased it mainly because it was one of the cheapest stands available. However I was very pleasantly surprised and this stand is really excellent. It is extremely sturdy and once you adjust it to the height and slant you want, as it's made of very sturdy metal it locks in place so won't move when you put normal pressure on the laptop keyboard when typing, etc. It can be manoeuvred very high and much higher than another Kensington stand I've got. Absolute bargain and can't recommend enough. Also the foot space of the stand quite small so won't take up much valuable desk space and you can store any additional keyboard /mouse you may use under it which is very neat. Can't recommend enough and super bargain at price.

We bought two of these (black and silver).One is for my wife's iPad, and it keeps it at a perfect height and angle for her to use it for any length of time.The other is for my laptop, and it, too, keeps it at a good height and angle, to allow it to have air circulate around it.They were not expensive, they are strong, although I would have preferred a more substantial piece to hold the laptop on the inclined surface. See the photograph.But, it's a good, solid piece of equipment.
